title: Jane Plastow obituary
summary: Jane Plastow, a professor of African theatre at the University of Leeds, dedicated her career to community-based theatre, African studies, and global development. She led the Centre for African Studies at Leeds from 2004 to 2014, overseeing an innovative theatre and global development MA program. In the 1990s, Plastow worked extensively with Eritrean artists and educators following the war of independence. Her most recent collaboration was with We Are Walukuba, a community group in Jinja, Uganda, where she challenged conventional theatre for development methods by co-creating long-term dialogical forms of artistic engagement. Her work resulted in several publications, including A History of East African Theatre (2020, 2021) and Community-Based Arts, Research and Activism in Uganda: We Are Walukuba (2025). Born in Tunbridge Wells, Kent, Plastow passed away at the age of 66 after a battle with cancer.

title: One in 12 secondary pupils put in isolation rooms at least once a week, study finds
summary: The study conducted by the University of Manchester reveals that one in 12 secondary school pupils are placed in isolation rooms at least once a week, spending over eight hours away from regular classes, missing more than a full day of lessons. This practice, known as internal exclusion, disproportionately affects children with special educational needs, those from low-income backgrounds, and students who identify as LGBTQ+. Black, Asian, and mixed heritage children are also more likely to be isolated than their white British peers. The use of isolation, often for minor rule breaches, has been criticized for its potential harm to a child's education and mental health. Unlike suspensions or permanent exclusions, there are no national rules governing the use of isolation, and no publicly available national data. The study, published in the British Educational Research Journal, highlights the need for investment in positive behavior support, restorative approaches, and better mental health provision to address the issue.

Liam, a carpenter by trade, also became a lecturer at the Municipal Technical College (now Belfast Met). His nephew, Diarmaid Ua Bruadair, is the principal of a secondary school in County Derry. title: Meta scrapped factcheckers ‘because systems were too complex’
